adjectives.description: staggering (comparative more staggering, superlative most staggering)

examples: The army suffered a staggering defeat.

entries.meaning: The motion of one who staggers.
examples: There are to whom the gods, in their bounty, give glory: but far oftener it is given in wrath, as a curse and a poison; disturbing the whole inner health and industry of the man; leading onward through dizzy staggerings and tarantula jiggings  […]

entries.meaning: The condition of being staggered or amazed.
examples: But these doubts, and fears, and staggerings, although they may be in the believer, yet they are not in his faith; these things argue the infirmity of his faith, indeed; but under all this, faith is fighting for the victory […]

entries.meaning: In animation, the repetition of a sequence of frames to show struggling effort
